sentence: Dear Potential Buyers
before you buy I would like you to know a few facts about this product
The color is cream - close to ivory
it is not white, in fact it is far from white
If you have a high performance job
a waiter,  a barman or you spend some  hours in office wearing the  suit
, than you will feel like wearing a plastic bag - wet and uncomfortable with strong sensation of aching
The information
on website and on shirt's  label indicates that it is 100% cotton
It is not
It is 100% polyester, uncomfortable to use
This shirt,  20-30 minutes after ironing, will lose it shape, and you will look like a rickshaw  driver after very long rainy day
The price for 100% polyester shirts is usually 70% cheaper  than cotton, because difficult to wear in cold or hot days
From the ethical point, looks like "Amazon" is taking very  strange business direction, by selling polyester as a cotton
It is not "Essential" it is "Strategic Mistake"
I returned the item
Not acceptable
I purchased a 16??32-33??French Blue shirt
Very much liked the color, the fabric, the fit when I first tried it on
It washed up nicely
I liked it so much that I anticipated buying two to three more

So, what?ôs the problem?  Well, when I put it on and with my hands at my side everything is great, however if I move my arms or do almost anything, the sleeves become 1-3 inches too short and I must return my hands to my sides and pull the sleeves back down
It seems like the shirt is just too small across the back
I'm really happy I decided to order one of these shirts
I was looking to buy a red/blue tattersall and when I saw this, I figured it was worth a shot
I typically wear Brooks Brothers non-iron shirts, and while these aren't the same quality, they are definitely comparable to brands such as Calvin Klein
For the money, it is a fantastic value and I would have given it 5 stars had it not run pretty small
This is marketed as a 'regular fit', and while I am certainly a large guy
, I expect a regular fit shirt to be relatively loose fitting given the measurements I buy
This will not fit you if you are, sorry, very overweight or obese
I am going to order a 18" neck next time and see how it fits
I bought this dress shirt from Amazon Basics and another dress shirt of the same size / color Kirkland brand from Costco as a test for which $20 men's long sleeve dress shirt is better
Costco wins
Comfortably
The Amazon Basics shirt looks thinner and cheaper
It's fabric is a bit stiffer and less comfortable
Either the sleeves are a bit shorter for the listed size, or the shirt shrank -- neither of those options is good
Lint and fuzz cling to the Amazon shirt more, even though I washed it and the Costco shirt at the same time
Overall, it's not an awful shirt, but if you've got access to a Costco, the choice for a $20 men's dress shirt is easy, and it's not Amazon Basics
These dress shirts are great
They are a nice white, fit well and awesome price

I am 5'7" and 180#, a little on the chunky side

I dont know the size
is a little bigger, not in the way I would like-so a nice, good looking fit is sometimes difficult to achieve, but this shirt manages to make me feel comfortable and make me look nice and fitted
This review is based on wearing the shirt once all day
I ordered an 18 1/2 neck 34-35 sleeve length
I am 6 feet 250 LBS
I am pleasantly surprised that the shirt fit perfectly and irons easily
It did not feel like I was wearing a piece of linen--it did not become wrinkly even after wearing it all day
The fabric kept it's shape all day like the comparable premium store bought brand
Note that this shirt is a classic fit with the traditional fabric
not the stretch-flex kind
I cannot vouch for it's durability over time but for the price, I will come back to buy another

over the past years, I have only bought shirts that have collar stays sewn in so they don?ôt get lost
I basically drilled two small holes in the stays and sewed them into the collar, and they now stay in
At this price, And otherwise good quality, I am happy to buy more and see the collar stays in the other shirts also

This review is for the white version
It's a very nicely made shirt, and all of the seams are impeccable with a very small number of uncut threads in places
I find it to be true to size, with one caveat regarding the sleeves
The sleeve length is perfect with my arms down, but the sleeves ride up more than those on my other dress shirts when I raise my arms
These have removable collar stays, which is my preference
The one thing that I like the least
and the reason for four stars instead of five, even at this price
is that the fabric is more transparent than my other shirts
At least with the white color, you'll see skin or an undershirt through it
It's not horrible, mind you, but I prefer a more opaque fabric
All in all, a nice shirt and a good value at the
current
$20 price point
This is a beautiful, pure white shirt
When I get a new white shirt, I do not usually take it out of its wrap that it comes in, because white shirts begin to age immediately, they begin to turn yellowish or dull

That is why men who must wear suits and ties to work must have a constant new supply of white shirts with long sleeves, in order to look their best,  The men get to the point when they can spot an older white shirt on a colleague, and then they start to think less of this colleague
You can solve this by occasionally wearing a blue shirt or a yellow shirt, if it matches your suit and socks, but best practice is to wear a gleamingly new white shirt
It must have long sleeves, as it is unprofessional to show your arms bare, even on the hottest days
This goes for women too - a businesswoman should not show bare arms
Or too much neck
It is unprofessional
As for hemlines, below the knee is best
I am an expert on dressing for the corporation, after having worked in the corporate world most of my life
Anyway, back to this shirt
As I said, I opened it and tried it on, and the sleeves are a bit too long
Too long is better than too short
Too long can be solved with a pair of good, old-fashioned sleeve garters that are white so that they don't stand out
Sleeve garters can be found at haberdashery shops or sometimes in the men's department of a good department store
So, you should have sleeve garters on hand
The size of a shirt is determined by the neck size
Unfortunately, I have always had a sensitive neck, so I must get a shirt with a neck size of 17 at least
This way I won't be pulling at my neck all day long
The top button must always be fastened or you will look slovenly
Also, your tie must be tied properly - a double Windsor knot is best
Please do not use a clip-on tie or a bow tie
Once in a while, a bow tie is acceptable - maybe once or twice a year, and it must be 100% silk - in fact, all ties must be 100% silk and you are judged by your tie's design and color
I have at least 150 ties
I do not wear striped ties
I prefer ties with abstract designs, paisleys, and other different designs, and ties must look fresh and unwrinkled
The color of a tie is important
I tend toward blues, purples, and lavenders, with intricate patterns

Once in a while I'll wear one of my favorites - a water-colored street scene in Paris, or a dark blue tie with light blue colored turtles that I bought in Switzerland - but do not wear favorites over and over
I have a black tie with red polka dots on it that I wear when I don't feel good
When you have many ties, you can just grab one in a hurry and wear it and it'll be fine
Again, back to the shirt
If you can see your skin through the shirt, you must wear a well-fitting white undershirt with short sleeves
You don't want to show your nipples or an extremely hirsuit body, or any scars
I have had heart surgery so I always wear an undershirt
To wrap this up, this is a good and useful shirt, but you must adhere to what I have said if you wish to appear well dressed

Amazon brands are increasing their scope of affordable products especially in their clothing lines and this shirt is a great example
The colors and pattern is conservative  enough to be warn in a business setting but is equally at home at a relaxed casual outing
Equally at home under a suit or paired with blue jeans or khakis
Construction and cut share details of shirts costing twice the price
The collar stays for example are removable and can be replaced with new plastic ones or metal inserts if you have them
The sleeves have dual buttons to accommodate your wrist size or watch  and the  sleeve placket also has a button
Extra buttons are sewn inside the bottom of the front packet to replace any that might come off over time
Stitching is clean and straight
There's a single front breast pocket and the alignment of the fabric pattern matches perfectly the underlying shirt pattern, which is critical in plaid shirt especially
Price is very affordable especially if you compare it to any designer label
Money was saved on the shirt fabric as it is a lightweight cotton and suitable, but it isn't a more substantial weave and cotton you would expect to find on a fine shirt
So while entirely suitable and attractive it will not replace a high end shirt if that's what you're expecting
I received the 32/33 inch sleeve and 16" neck which I should not have ordered knowing my arms are extra long, and as expected, if I stretch my arms out straight, the sleeves are just not long enough
The cut leans more toward an athletic cut so works best with a slimmer torso
All told, a very good value for the price
Attractive and versatile
A small deduction for the lower end weight and lack of heft of the fabric
My husband seems to wear a popular size when it comes to dress shirts, so finding them in the local stores can be tough-so I often order online
For the most part-men's fitted shirts like this
sized collar and sleeve length
seem to fit pretty universally, but for some reason I found this a bit big when he tried it on
Granted many companies now make a 'regular' fit and slim fit
This is a regular cut, but still seems a bit big in the chest area
However, a good white shirt is always needed-and because this one seems to run a bit big, my husband can wear it with our without a tie-with for work, without for a more casual, business look
The shirt is well made-buttons sewn on properly, cuffs stitched nicely and the collar lies flat
The material is soft without being too sheer, but has enough rigidity to not look sloppy
And the price point makes this a steal
less than $25 for a well made, men's dress shirt?  Yes please
Overall, I like this shirt -- it fits pretty well, it's attractive, and it's well-made
Fabric is strong without being rough or stiff
Seams are clean and strong
The plaid pattern is muted and attractive
Fits in with what all the other guys at my office job are wearing
My one complaint is that the arms/shoulders are a bit snug

I've cultivated a bit of a belly over the years, and this fits well through the midsection, but it's just a touch tight through the shoulders, and it's snug enough on the arms that flexing my bicep makes me feel like the Hulkamaniac
On the other hand, it's a dress shirt
It doesn't give enough freedom of movement for the secret service, but if you're like me and you spend 8 hours sitting in front of a computer, it's not going to be a problem
This is a quality dress shirt and a bargain at the price -- take that, designers
I have deducted one star because arm movement is slightly restricted -- if you raise your arms, the shirt body lifts up as well
A little more give under the arms would be welcome
Otherwise, though, the shirt has everything I like -- a chest pocket, spread collar with slots for stays, two spare buttons attached to the hem, a good long hem, etc
The finish seems topnotch -- no loose threads -- and the fabric is 100% cotton for breathability
The colors are subdued in this purple tattersall version -- they appear to be a muted purple and gray
All in all, then, this is a great shirt for the money, and the movement issue probably won't matter to workers sitting at desks
It is hard to believe that this shirt can be offered at its price point
What an incredible value for $20
I usually wear a medium or 15 and 1/2 inch neck and the fit was right on
